author: Gus_263
title: Little bohrok
review: It have bohrok itens: a krana, a shield, orange eyes(same of gahlok) but is cool to play. Have some blue pieces, and the head is maded with a shield, also contain a hook. The feet are of tohunga. Great for little set, can be upgraded, or be upgrade for some creations.

author: ejcmoorhouse
title: first bionicle!
review: This was my first ever bionicle! don't really like bionicle that much haven't really paid attention to the story and this set didn't last long the head probly suvied for the longest! but it is a good simple cheap set worth no more than 50p MAX!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Bohrok Va) - Gahlok Va Review
review:
This is a good figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only two pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 26 pieces and it was 3 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 12 cents per piece which is a good value for what we get here!

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8550-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the head, the feet and the torso can be moved. On one hand you can see a claw which LEGO used for Toa Mata Gali. The back has a piece where you can put a krana in, too.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de



Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Odeinoichus
title: Bohrok Va = Matoran
review:
Set #8550 Gahlok Va: I aquired these sets from the local 7-Eleven, which surprised me at the time because I wasn't used to finding LEGO sets in a convenience store. So I chose to purchase all six of them.

 

Gahlok Va is meant to be a companion to Gahlok, he or she (not sure if it is meant to be female.) is a small impulse set that uses limited pieces to build a model the size of the Matoran perhaps to be their enemies or nemesis. I never actually checked into the model's backstory on LEGO's Bionicle site, if they had any info. The Bohrok Va as a set are actually quite interesting looking and the pieces are useful for building up MOCs.

 

Aside from the pieces and the instructions the Gahlok Va also included a small fold-out poster which showed Gahlok next to Gahlok Va in action poses. Overall despite being some interesting little sets I don't think they're must owns for Bionicle collections. Still if you're interested in these little sets or looking for cheap Bionicle pieces these are a good source for parts. And it also comes with a Krana.
